intro: Amblyanthe bismarckiensis, commonly known as the Bismarck Island daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Bismarck Archipelago in Papua New Guinea. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a daisy-like appearance, and it blooms during the wet season. Amblyanthe bismarckiensis is relatively rare and has limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
